background: An airport is trying to figure out the optimal number of escalators and elevators to install to transport passengers efficiently while minimizing space usage.

parameters.definition: The number of people an escalator can transport every minute
The number of people an elevator can transport every minute
The units of space an escalator takes up
The units of space an elevator takes up
The minimum number of people the airport needs to have the capacity to transport every minute
The ratio of the minimum number of escalators to elevators
The minimum number of elevators that must be used

constraints.description: Total transport capacity of escalators and elevators must be at least CapacityMinimum people per minute
constraints.code:
# Add minimum transport capacity constraint
model.addConstr(EscalatorNumber * EscalatorRate + ElevatorNumber * ElevatorRate >= CapacityMinimum, name="min_transport_capacity")

constraints.description: Number of escalators must be at least EscalatorElevatorRatio times the number of elevators
constraints.code:
EscalatorNumber >= EscalatorElevatorRatio * ElevatorNumber
model.addConstr(EscalatorNumber >= EscalatorElevatorRatio * ElevatorNumber, name="escalator_elevator_ratio")

constraints.description: There must be at least ElevatorMinNumber elevators in the airport
constraints.code:
ElevatorMinNumber = data["ElevatorMinNumber"] # scalar parameter
model.addConstr(ElevatorNumber >= ElevatorMinNumber, name="min_elevator_constraint")

constraints.description: Number of escalators must be non-negative
constraints.code:
# Since the variable "EscalatorNumber" is already guaranteed to be non-negative by its type definition,
# no additional constraint is necessary.
# However, if we needed to explicitly add a constraint, we would do the following:
# model.addConstr(EscalatorNumber >= 0, name="non_negative_escalators")

constraints.description: Number of elevators must be non-negative
constraints.code:
# Ensure that the number of elevators is non-negative
model.addConstr(ElevatorNumber >= 0, name="elevator_non_negativity")

constraints.description: The airport's transport capacity for passengers must meet or exceed the minimum required capacity
constraints.code:
# Transport capacity constraint
model.addConstr(EscalatorNumber * EscalatorRate + ElevatorNumber * ElevatorRate >= CapacityMinimum, name="transport_capacity")

constraints.description: The number of escalators must be at least a certain ratio of the number of elevators
constraints.code:
# Add constraint for the number of escalators to be at least a certain ratio of the number of elevators
model.addConstr(EscalatorNumber >= EscalatorElevatorRatio * ElevatorNumber, name="escalator_to_elevator_ratio")

constraints.description: The number of elevators used must be at least the minimum number specified
constraints.code:
# Add constraint for the minimum number of elevators
model.addConstr(ElevatorNumber >= ElevatorMinNumber, "min_elevators")

variables.definition: The number of escalators installed in the airport
The number of elevators installed in the airport

objective.description: Minimize the total units of space used by escalators and elevators
objective.code:
# Set objective function
model.setObjective(EscalatorNumber * EscalatorSpace + ElevatorNumber * ElevatorSpace, gp.GRB.MINIMIZE)
